item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Ali Smith
item.description: "Happy is what you realize you are a fraction of a second before it's too late." -- Ali Smith

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Ali Smith
item.description: "Books mean all possibilities. They mean moving out of yourself, losing yourself, dying of thirst and living to your full. They mean everything." -- Ali Smith

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Ali Smith
item.description: "There is a kind of poetry, bad and good, in evrything, everywhere we look." -- Ali Smith

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Ali Smith
item.description: "There are things that can't be said, because it's hard to have to know them." -- Ali Smith

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Ali Smith
item.description: "Tonight I can smell the season the way it's usually only possible to at the very first moments of its return, before you're used to it, when you've forgotten its smell, then there it is back in the air and the flow of things shifting and resettling again." -- Ali Smith

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I think we are well advised to keep on nodding terms with the people we used to be, whether we find them attractive company or not. Otherwise they turn up unannounced and surprise us, come hammering on the mind's door at 4 a.m. of a bad night and demand to know who deserted them, who betrayed them, who is going to make amends." -- Joan Didion

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I write entirely to find out what I'm thinking, what I'm looking at, what I see and what it means. What I want and what I fear." -- Joan Didion

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Character — the willingness to accept responsibility for one's own life — is the source from which self-respect springs." -- Joan Didion

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "I'm not telling you to make the world better, because I don't think that progress is necessarily part of the package. I'm just telling you to live in it. Not just to endure it, not just to suffer it, not just to pass through it, but to live in it. To look at it. To try to get the picture. To live recklessly. To take chances. To make your own work and take pride in it. To seize the moment. And if you ask me why you should bother to do that, I could tell you that the grave's a fine and private place, but none I think do there embrace. Nor do they sing there, or write, or argue, or see the tidal bore on the Amazon, or touch their children. And that's what there is to do and get it while you can and good luck at it." -- Joan Didion

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "As your lover describes you, so you are." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "What you risk reveals what you value." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Whoever it is you fall in love with for the first time, not just love but be in love with, is the one who will always make you angry, the one you can't be logical about." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "When I look at my life I realise that the mistakes I have made, the things I really regret, were not errors of judgement but failures of feeling." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "It's hard to remember that this day will never come again. That the time is now and the place is here and that there are no second chances at a single moment." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: *heartrl* add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I want someone who is fierce and will love me until death and knows that love is as strong as death, and be on my side forever and ever. I want someone who will destroy and be destroyed by me." -- Jeanette Winterson
